other_tests.findings: The liver demonstrates diffuse increase in echogenicity compatible with fatty infiltration. No focal hepatic lesions are present. No intra or extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation; common bile duct measures 5 mm. Main portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder contains numerous stones, without gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, or sonographic Murphy's sign. Small amount of ascites is present. Limited images of the kidneys show no hydronephrosis with right kidney measuring 12.0 cm and left kidney measuring 12.8 cm, both within normal limits. Spleen measures 11.4 cm and is not enlarged. Visualization of the pancreas was obscured by overlying bowel gas.
